channel.title: chronicles in coding
channel.description: blog inspired by true events on movie screens, unix and related stuff

item.title: Python Course 301
item.dc:creator: Diego Dorta
item.description: Before jumping to Machine Learning course, there are a few fundamental concepts of Python that is desired to know and review it due its intensive use during the course. If you get Python or it is already familiar, feel free to skip this 301 section. If you still are a beginner it will be very helpful to learn the following examples before moving on.

item.title: Python Course 201
item.dc:creator: Diego Dorta
item.description: This section approaches the list concept in Python and jumps a head a little to demonstrate how data structures are important while developing applications for ML projects.

item.title: Python Course 101
item.dc:creator: Diego Dorta
item.description: In most of the programming languages a variable is a named location used to store data in the memory. Each variable must have a unique name called identifier. It is helpful to think of variables as container that hold data which can be changed later throughout programming.

item.title: ML Course
item.dc:creator: Diego Dorta
item.description: This course has a purpose to provide an initial and also deeper contact with a practical view and details behind Machine Learning methods. The minimal requirements for this course is to have a little math background and knowledge in programming languages.

item.title: Introductory Python Course for ML
item.dc:creator: Diego Dorta
item.description: This course was prepared to offer concepts/knowledge to be further used in the Machine Learning course. The acquired theoretical and practical understanding of this module can help getting a better comprehension of the next modules.

item.title: Fruits Code - Supervised Learning
item.dc:creator: Diego Dorta
item.description: This post consists to collect training data. For solving this problem, we are going to write a function to classify a piece of fruit. For starters, it will take a description of the fruit as input and predict whether itâ€™s an apple or an orange as output, based on features like its weight and texture.

item.title: OpenCL Overview on iMX

item.description: Post under review: a few examples codes are being developed

item.title: From Auxerre to the World
item.dc:creator: Diego Dorta
item.description: This code was written for plotting the terms of Fourier series for a Square Wave.

item.title: Building U-Boot for iMX8 QXP Board
item.dc:creator: Diego Dorta
item.description: The purpose behind this post consists in explaining a way to get started with iMX8QXP MEK board from its source code. Due the constant maintenance this post may stop working eventually.

item.title: Setting up Yocto for i.MX BSP releases
item.dc:creator: Diego Dorta
item.description: This previous post may not work all time due the constant maintenance. To solve this issue, this post intents to teach how to start using actual i.MX BSP releases from code aurora.
